sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, a hedge knight is a wandering knight without a master.  Many are quite poor, and they travel the length and breadth of [[Westeros]] looking for gainful employment.

Less scrupulous hedge knights put their martial training to use by resorting to banditry. For this reason, hedge knights are often mistrusted and considered disreputable. The term "hedge knight" itself is considered disparaging and some hedge knights can be described as "upjumped" - bandits who were knighted by other hedge knights, with no real prestige to their title.  Nonetheless there are some chivalrous hedge knights who value their honor and who try to uphold their vows, in fact sometimes more so than in comparison to other knights who are higher up in the social strata, and feel that their high status means that they don't have to strictly follow their vows.  

The first novella in the ''[[Tales of Dunk and Egg]]'' series is entitled ''The Hedge Knight''.
